event: Early agricultural communities settle mainland Southeast Asia
Mon kingdoms spread Theravada Buddhism in the Chao Phraya basin
Sukhothai kingdom emerges as an early Thai state
Ayutthaya founded as a regional trading and military power
Ayutthaya expands after the decline of Angkor
Portuguese traders establish contact with Siam
Thonburi kingdom reunifies Siam under Taksin
Bangkok founded and Chakri dynasty established
Bowring Treaty opens Siam to global trade
Territorial losses to France preserve Siamese independence
Absolute monarchy replaced by constitutional rule
Thailand emerges from World War II without colonization
